text: BMI stands for body mass index it's a
system used to give a rough idea as to
whether people are under or overweight
the BMI index compares a person's height
against their weight the heavier you are
compared with how tall you are the
higher your BMI value will be this is
based around the idea that a person who
is taller should weigh more the NHS
advises at a BMI of between eighteen and
a half and twenty-five is a healthy
weight under eighteen and a half
indicates that you may be underweight
over 25 indicates that you may be
overweight and over thirty indicates
that you may be obese the BMI idea is
sometimes criticized as some people can
be incorrectly labelled as overweight by
the system people with a high muscle
mass such as boxers or rugby players for
example may be labeled as overweight
it's quite easy to get a BMI measurement
to start with you need to measure your
height and weight then visit the BMI
calculator page on diabetes Co UK which
has a tool that to work out your own BMI
value
